001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime;
002
003import java.time.Instant;
004import java.time.ZoneId;
005import java.time.ZoneOffset;
006import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
007
008public class CoreDateTimeUtils {
009
010    /**
011     * Gets the current value of {@link ZoneOffset}, which depends on system settings of operational system
012     * and on the current time (because of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daylight_saving_time">daylight saving time</a>).
013     *
014     * @return the current value of {@link ZoneOffset}
015     */
016    public static ZoneOffset systemZoneOffset() {
017        return ZoneId.systemDefault().getRules().getOffset(Instant.now());
018    }
019
020    /**
021     * Transform the string-representation of {@link Instant}
022     * in {@link DateTimeFormatter#ISO_INSTANT ISO_INSTANT}-format
023     * into {@link DateTimeTriplet}
024     *
025     * @param instantStr string-representation of {@link Instant} in format like {@code 2007-12-03T10:15:30.00Z}.
026     * @return the instance of {@link DateTimeTriplet}
027     *
028     * @see Instant#parse(CharSequence)
029     */
030    public static DateTimeTriplet dtt(String instantStr) {
031        return new DateTimeTriplet(Instant.parse(instantStr));
032    }
033}
